intro: Sphaerosacme nepalensis, commonly known as the Nepal sphaerosacme, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in umbels, and it produces small, round fruits. Sphaerosacme nepalensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and potential medicinal properties.
